entry.title: Re: Duplicate MATMAS IDoc Generation via POIM and BD10 –...
entry.content:
Hi Dominik,
thank you very much for your quick reply and support! Unfortunately, the first suggestion doesn’t work for me, as I have to use POIM to generate the other IDocs like LOIBOM, LOIWCS and LOIROU. As you mentioned, POIM always generates a MATMAS as well and I haven’t found a way to suppress that. Regarding the second suggestion with BD93: while it does send CLFMAS only, it lacks the material reference. That means I can’t trace which materials belong to the sent classification data. In contrast, BD10 includes the material linkage in the CLFMAS, which is essential for my use case. So unfortunately, both options leave me with a duplicate MATMAS situation or incomplete classification data. Do you (or anyone else) know of a workaround to send CLFMAS with material reference without triggering another MATMAS?

Thanks again and best regards

Robin

entry.title: Re: Transport Eclipse to another computer
entry.content: The data is stored in your Eclipse Workspace (not related to the user). If you didn't backup your workspace, the data is lost.

The Team type, function profile etc will be saved a customizing transport request, while the team category etc will have to be captured via the ATO.

You can check these objects in SE09 tasklist and see if they have been saved already.

Regards

Anirban

entry.title: Destination Error in UI Integration Card while accessing from SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi All,

Writing this blog after solving my issue which I got unexpected.

Requirement:

I developed one UI Integration Card in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) and I was able to the Preview of the card in the BAS which is getting data based on Stanadard Odata services from S/4HANA.

After that I Packaged the UI Integration Card in Content Package and imported in the SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition and I was able to access the card in my site. 

 

Error Details:

But suddenly effective from 25th July 2025, I got the below Error (PFA the error for same):

Destination "ecqrtcard" could not be resolved.

No technical destination found. Content Channel ID: "ovps". Please contact your administrator.

suddenly starting from 25th July 2025, I was getting above error. It might be becuase of SAP did some update in Standard Destination Configuraiton in BTP because earlier to 25ht July my card was working without error.

I raised the quesiton in the community but no one replied there, below is the link for my question where I only answered to my question:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/ui-integration-card-error-while-accessing-in-sap-build-work-zone-standard/qaq-p/14162532#M4921009

 

Solution:

After reading lot of blog I was not able to find the solution then raised with SAP Support. They replied back with the following document:

https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/map-card-aliases-to-destinations

So here is the solution of the issue. We need to configure the Alias in the Content Package coniguration also in the Work Zone, PFA the below  Screen shot of the configuration:

1 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

3 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

4 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

5 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

After this configuraiton we need to refresh the site it will work (PFA the Screen shot "UI Card Access in BWZ, Standard Edition".

 

Hope this will help community to fix the issue.

 

Summary:

We need to get the alert from SAP if they are doing any patch update in the btp service and same reply I got over the Incident from SAP Team. After every patch we need to do end to end testing of our application to avoid any issue.

 

Conclusion:

So the final conclusion is that We need to map the aliases in each and every content package which we are creating in the Build Work Zone and need to test the application if we get any alert from SAP Team for patch update in SAP BTP Services.

 

Thanks.

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: Re: Not able to see "Deactivate line" and "Delate last ra...
entry.content:
The most common reasons could be

  • These buttons were introduced with SAP S/4HANA Cloud CE2105 for TDT countries (e.g., Turkey, Dominican Republic, etc.). If your system is on an earlier release or not scoped for those countries, the buttons won’t appear.
  • The buttons only show for tax codes with one condition and one period. If your tax code has multiple conditions or periods, SAP disables the deactivation option.

Check SAP Note 3056410 which explains the behavior and limitations of SSCUI 101016 and how to enable deactivation features

entry.title: Re: How to Perform 80/20 Spend Analysis on Suppliers in S...
entry.content:
@govardhan_vegi98 

I had tried this and there is a SAC limitation that creates a challenge. In Pareto analysis you need a running total of contribution %  sorted by contribution. SAC running total calculation does not follow sort order.

https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/0003294430

The Table client calculation gives the correct results but unfortunately you cannot refer to client calculation in any charts or measures so getting the pareto chart or table becomes an issue.

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Joule for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition - A Comprehensive Setup Guide
entry.content:
@MatiasLinari  

In fact, a lot of things could be happening lol. I'll leave below a response from the maintainer of the document we're following:

You may try checking the following things:

1.Check the blog:common issues faced in Joule activation for S/4 HANA Private Cloud system. 

2. Ensure the principal propagation is working fine. If so, check the monitoring in cloud connector. 

3. Ensure the APIs mentioned in the SAP Note 3523238 ( Attachment -> Business Roles and API for Transactional Capabilities.xlsx) are active in the S/4 HANA system. Also, ensure the business roles mentioned in the attachments in the given note are assigned to the user. 

4. Make sure the role provisioning job runs post assignment of the roles. Check the roles are moved to SAP Build workzone by going to the settings->Identity provisioning (Search roles with the email id).

entry.title: Re: ONB 2.0: Assign Onboarding Data Collections dynamically using a Lookup Table
entry.content: Thank you Gopi!

entry.title: Re: Condition contract management delta accrual Foreign c...
entry.content:
I presume, it could be due to the following, if the said SAP note not addressed your issue

  1. The GR-based accruals might be posted in both document and local currency → reversed correctly using original FX rate.
  2. The Delta accruals might be posted in document currency, but during reversal, SAP treats them as local currency and converts them again using settlement M rate, not the original one.

Check the following:-

  • Ensure your delta accrual condition type (e.g. RED2) has proper subtotal settings and manual flag in the pricing procedure. Confirm that REA1 → REA2 and RED1 → RED2 mappings are correctly defined in Accrual Groups.
  • Check if the delta condition type is set to statistical or manual—this affects how currencies are handled. Review if the currency conversion logic is being overridden or skipped for delta lines.

entry.title: Re: A question on SAP Marketing Cloud Coupons (and Offers)
entry.content:
Hi, 

you can use API API_MKT_COUPON_SRV to achieve that. The relationship between the coupon, cod e and contact key is stored in a database table which can be queried via the entity CouponCod eUsage from the API mentioned above. This could look like this: 

https://{{yourhost}}:{{yourPort}}/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_MKT_COUPON_SRV/CouponCod eUsages?$filter=Coupon UUID eq guid'{{yourCoupon UUID}}'&$format=json&$top=100  . 

For more information please refer to the API hub: https://api.sap.com/api/API_MKT_COUPON_SRV/resource/Marketing_Coupon_Cod e_Usage

Unfortunately this returns only the keys of the coupon cod e and contact. You will need further calls to retrieve the contact ids (or names) and the textual coupon cod e from the keys. 

Hope that helps!

Best Regards

-Klaus

entry.title: Re: Duplicate MATMAS IDoc Generation via POIM and BD10 –...
entry.content:
Hi Dominik,

thank you for the great tip. I think this actually works for my requirement! Unlike with LOIBOM, LOIWCS, and LOIROU, it seems that POIM doesn’t strictly rely on the material selection at the top of the screen when it comes to classifications. When I include the class and class type in the section you pointed out, POIM generates CLFMAS IDocs for all materials that belong to the selected class, which is exactly what I need. Since I know which classes I want to distribute, this gives me the material linkage, without triggering another MATMAS via BD10. Thanks again for the helpful suggestion!

Best regards,
Robin

entry.title: Re: Page Break within a table in quote form does not form...

I believe you can resolve this by checking the dimensions on the master page. To access the master page, go to View > Master Pages. Then, use Window to add the Layout tab. Within the master page, you can adjust the dimensions and position of the header. Hopefully, this helps you get started.

entry.title: Re: component consumption in a multilevel BOM in an order
entry.content:
To calculate the actual quantity of raw material N1 consumed in the production of finished material F1, based on daily production confirmations, not BOM structure, some key points you need to take into consideration and they are:

  1. Identify all sub-assemblies of F1 that include N1.
  2. Exclude N1 consumption from other finished materials.
  3. Use actual consumption data by pulling from production order confirmations (e.g. via CO11N). Include goods issue movements like 261 from MB51
  4. Consider tables like AFKO, AFVC, AUFM, RESB, MSEG, MKPF
  5. Focus on 261 (GI for order) and 101 (GR for order)
  6. Linkage logic can be check AUFNR to tie confirmations and goods issues to F1. Traverse BOM using STPO, STKO to map N1 under F1

Key SAP Tables for BOM Traversal are

entry.title: Re: How to build a responsive UI for a RAP business object that starts an asynchronous process
entry.content:
Hi @SumitKundu ,

sorry for my late reply.

1. Yes, bgpf can be used in SAP S/4HANA public cloud edition

2. No, bgpf can only be used in developer extensibility and not in key user apps because the objects, e.g. the interface if_bgmc_op_single_tx_uncontr has only been released for "use in cloud development" but NOT for "use in key user apps".

Kind regards,

Andre

entry.title: Re: How to build a responsive UI for a RAP business object that starts an asynchronous process
entry.content:
@AbhishekSharma sorry for my late reply.

It is not clear for me what you mean by "manually raised". 

The event is raised when a certain field of the RAP BO is updated. 
So the scenario here is that after saving the BO the asynchronous process is started. At the end of this process exactly that field of the calling instance of the RAP BO is being updated. As a result the event is raised and the UI is updated.

It would also work if some kind of application job would update lots of entities. Then the user that is looking at the data using a Fiori app would be able to see how the data is updated in his or her UI.

Hope this clarifies your request.

Kind regards,

Andre

entry.title: Re: Consume SAP BTP Document Information Extraction service for custom documents in ABAP
entry.content:
Hi @tejasjani 
My 90 days BTP trial account ended, so I started a new trial. 
In the new trial the SAP Document Extraction Tool is renamed to SAP Document AI and probaly there has also been other functional changes. 

Anyway, my ABAP program, that didn't receive back the data, now works 100% and I receive the data back after 10-20 seconds of polling.

There was one thing I had to do that I don't think you mention in the blog. I had to implement a certificate in transaction STRUST to make the connection to the DOX APIs work.
I guess there are different ways to setup the connections, but this is what workes in my setup:

  • I use SM59 and cl_http_client=>create_by_destination for the authentication.
  • For the DOX endpoints I use cl_http_client=>create_by_url and I could only make this work after installing the certificate. 
  • I run the ABAP part in a good old SAP ERP system with SAP_BASIS release 750.

Thanks again for your blog.
I have experimented with the DOX before, but only integrated in SAP Build Process automation. I am an ABAP developer, so naturally I find this option to call the DOX APIs from ABAP program much more usefull.

Regards 

Thomas.

entry.title: Does the SAP NEO (Tomcat 10 Runtime) bind the DB as a JNDI resource for Jakarta EE 9 applications?
entry.content:
Hi,

 I am migrating a Java 8 OData 2 Maven EclipseLink application that runs on BTP Neo (runtime Tomcat 9) to a Java 17,  Jakarta EE9 ,OData2, Maven, EclipseLink application running on on BTP Neo (runtime Tomcat 10).

It fails with the error –

Cannot invoke "jakarta.persistence.EntityManagerFactory.createEntityManager()" because "this.emf" is null

I have use the Tomcat migration toll and changed the namespaces, e.g., javax.servlet*, javax.persistence.*, etc... to the Jakarta EE9 equivalents (jakarta.servlet*, jakarta,persistence*).

entry.title: Re: No materials were selected for the costing run CK078...
entry.content:
CK11N is designed for individual material costing, while CK40N is for mass costing runs. So even if both use the same date and material, CK40N has stricter selection logic and dependencies.

In your case, the error CK078 could be due to

  • The selection criteria in CK40N didn’t match any materials.
  • The costing variant or valuation variant setup is missing or inconsistent.
  • The BOM explosion didn’t find any valid components due to missing master data or validity dates.
  • Transfer control is not used, which may affect how materials are picked up depending on your config.

What you can do is ensure the Costing Variant & Valuation Variant are properly configured in OKKN and match what CK40N expects. Double-check that the material is assigned to the plant and included in the costing run selection. In CK40N, verify that the costing run name is unique and the selection step includes the correct material type and plant. CK40N uses structure explosion logic that may skip materials if BOMs are incomplete or inactive.

Finally, to confirm on the above, run CK40N and select only one material manually. Use a simple costing variant with minimal valuation strategy. Check if it gets picked up in the structure explosion. If it works, the issue is likely with selection filters or config.

entry.title: Ready to master SAP Integration Suite setup, management, and security?
entry.content:
I recommend accessing our Administering SAP Integration Suite learning journey. 

Overview 

This journey offers comprehensive knowledge on administering the SAP Integration Suite, including essential tasks, setup, capability management, and role responsibilities. 

Learning objectives
After completing this learning journey, you will be able to confidently set up and manage the SAP Integration Suite. You will understand what the Integration Suite is, how to plan its use, and how to handle user roles and permissions. You will explore the suite’s main features, including in-depth looks at API Management, Event Mesh, and Cloud Integration. Additionally, you'll learn how to establish secure connections and effectively monitor your integration scenarios.

Prerequisites

  • Introduction to SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) Administration
  • Developing with SAP Integration Suite  

Please post your question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you.  

I appreciate your feedback, and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards,

Susann

entry.title: Re: In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public edition unable to deactiv...
entry.content:
Hello @Rohit0909 

the Deactivate option in the IAM Apps section might be unavailable if

  • The app exists in multiple catalogues, and one does not support IAM
  • The app is marked as mandatory or dependent in the catalogue definition
  • The catalogue or role hasn’t fully synced or refreshed in the backend

Even if the app is assigned via a single catalogue that supports IAM, these constraints can still apply.
What you should do:

  • Use View Catalogue Assignments app to check which catalogue includes the app and confirm it supports IAM
  • In Maintain Business Roles,  run Check to validate catalogue-role consistency
  • Remove and reassign the role in “Maintain Business Users” to trigger IAM refresh

Maintain Business Users for Administrator

Let me know if it helps

Chuma

entry.title: *** New Get Certified series covering all areas in the C_S4CFI certification.** Register now
entry.content:
Overview

In this Get Certified series, expert trainers will deliver knowledge transfer sessions covering all areas in the C_S4CFI certification.

Learners who attend the series will receive expert-guided support to complement their self-study activities. Through the live sessions, they will be part of a group where summaries of course content are presented, complicated topics are repeated, and questions can be clarified.

To prepare for the exam, you should first work through all courses in the learning journey Implementing Financial Accounting in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. In addition, you should join the live sessions. Your trainer will review the content and focus on the most important topics relevant to the exam, to give you the best chance of success.

The following content will be covered:

  • Session 1: Kick Off: Outlining the series, introducing the certification, explaining the question types, tips for preparation, sample questions in the exam interface
  • Session 2: Implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Unit 1 - 7
  • Session 3: Implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Unit 8 - 12
  • Session 4: Detailing Accruals Management & Detailing Financial Statement Reporting
  • Session 5: Detailing Configuration of R2R Posting Processes
  • Session 6: Detailing Settings for Asset Accounting, Detailing Asset Accounting Integration Aspects & Detailing Asset Accounting Year-End Closing Activities
  • Session 7: Detailing Down Payments Execution , Detailing the Configuration for the Payment Run & Detailing Process Automation in Accounts Payable
  • Session 8: Detailing Special G/L Transactions in Accounts Receivable & Detailing SAP Cash Application and Processing Rules for Bank Statements
  • Session 9: Detailing Dispute and Collections Management & Detailing Credit Management Processes in Accounts Receivable
  • Session 10: Detailing the Dunning Run and closing wrap-up before the exam

Learning objectives

After participating in this Get Certified live session series, you will understand the format, scope and be ready to attempt the certification C_S4CFI

entry.title: Re: SAP Public cloud Sourcing and Procurement- Monitor Pu...
entry.content:
Hi @Rushabh1810 

A very good morning to you too.

Thank you for the confirmation. You’ve done everything expected up to this point.

Only item-level down payments on approved Purchase Orders are visible in that app See KBA 3071689 for more details. If your PO is still in a 'To Be Approved' or “draft” state, or the down payment is defined only at the header but not the item, the app won’t show it. See SAP Support Portal for further details.

My suggestion is to check:

  • Confirm your PO has been approved/released.
  • Confirm you defined the down payment at the item-level, not just the header.

Once those conditions are met, the app should appear in your Launchpad and show your PO.

Best regards,

Chris

entry.title: Partner function not available in Manage Purchase Order app
entry.content:
In the Manage Purchase Order application, the Partner function or Partner tab is missing when creating a new purchase order or when viewing existing purchase orders associated with Partner roles.
This issue is not observed in the Purchase Order Advanced app (ME2xN), where the Partner function is visible. However, the Partner function remains unavailable in other purchase order applications.

The absence of the Partner function in the Manage Purchase Orders app is due to it not being enabled in the system configurations.

This function can be activated through the IMG, following the specified path for both SAP S/4 HANA On-Premise and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition.
Path --> SAP Customising Implementation Guide -> Materials Management -> Purchasing -> Environment Data -> Enable Partner Functions in Manage Purchase Orders Application.

If It's SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition, use SSCUI - 106258 – Enable Partner Functions in Manage Purchase Orders (PO) Application.

Important Note: Once the switch state is changed to ON, it cannot be set to OFF again. 

After activating the above-given configuration Partner tab will appear in the "Manage Purchase Order" app.

 

Thanks 
Santosh G
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Sourcing and Procurement SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sourcing and Procurement

entry.title: Re: No materials were selected for the costing run CK078...
entry.content:
In which version, you are working. There is one SAP note 587881 for this issue CK078 but it is for lower version.

Now coming to your issue, not sure, whether you run ck40n with new a New Costing Run name. If not, once again, run ck40n with new a New Costing Run name and check for the below parameters.

As you would know, CK40N uses quantity structure determination, which requires active BOM for the material, Valid routing or recipe and Validity dates that match the costing date. CK11N can bypass some of these checks, but CK40N is stricter. So while running ck40n again with new name, ensure the following: -

After creating the costing run, go to Costing Level Overview. Make sure the costing levels are selected and saved before running structure explosion. If no costing level is flagged, CK40N won’t pick up any materials, even if they’re valid.

Also, test with the below parameters

  • Only one material
  • Costing level manually selected
  • BOM and routing confirmed as active
  • Validity date aligned with costing date

If it still fails, try enabling log output to see where the selection fails.

entry.title: Re: Lease contract condition
entry.content:
Try the below approach which I am not sure whether it will work

Go to RECN (Real Estate Contract Management). Select your lease contract and create a change version. Set the change date to sometime in 2025 (e.g., 01.01.2025).

In the change version, go to the Conditions tab,  locate the condition for the period 3.04.2024 – 2.04.2027,  reduce the amount to 90,000 and set the new validity date to reflect only 2025.

You may need to split the condition so that:

  • 3.04.2024 – 31.12.2024 = 0
  • 01.01.2025 – 31.12.2025 = 90,000

If the original 270,000 was already posted, you’ll need to reverse the excess payments using transaction F-02 or FB08 Or post an adjustment entry to reflect the revised payment schedule.

In the same change version, go to the Contract Term tab. Set the new end date to 31.12.2025 (or your desired termination date). This ensures no future conditions or valuations are generated beyond 2025.

Run the valuation again using RECNVAL or mass valuation. This will update the lease liability and right-of-use asset based on the new payment and shortened term

entry.title: Re: Unable to Clear Special G/L Transactions with CME Ind...
entry.content:
Hi @Blas4 

Thanks for the visuals and your precise question.

  • you cannot replace or customize the Special G/L indicator “S” In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition. This is fixed by SAP, as described in KBA 2761212.
  • You can, however, adjust the reconciliation account for indicator “S” through the Automatic Account Determination configuration (SSCUI 100297), but this does not affect clearing behaviour.
  • Manual clearing of items with indicator “S” is only supported if they were posted via a down‑payment request. Then they can be cleared using the “Post to G/L Account” tab in the Clear Incoming Payments app. Simply changing payment method or customizing the indicator will not enable manual clearing in standard apps.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: CAP + SAPUI5 - How does auth work?
entry.content:
Hi again,

after having extensively tried and researched on this topic it seems to me that there is no other way than having an authenticated user with the respective roles to trigger an action (POST Request) from a deployed SAPUI5 app. 

Which is why I have been trying to set up XSUAA token-based auth. However, I can't seem to make it work. The setup of the CAP backend should be alright, as I have already tested and verified that it works the way it should via POSTMAN (Got the token, triggered the endpoints, etc...)

Nonetheless, it does not work from the SAPUI5 Apps.  As soon as I change the destination pointing to the CAP backend to OAuth2ClientCredentials/OAuth2UserTokenExchange the apps won't start at all - 500 - or they do start but still hit a 401 OR 500 error (On every request - even get). The credentials (Clientid/secret) are 100% correct.

What I did regarding the frontend:

- Setup the destination with the respective OAuth2 credentials from the xsuaa service instance

- Setup the xs-app.json: 

{
  "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^/odata/(.*)$",
      "target": "/odata/$1",
      "destination": "THE DESTINATION I CONFIGURED",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
    },
    {
      "source": "^/resources/(.*)$",
      "target": "/resources/$1",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "destination": "ui5"
    },
    {
      "source": "^/test-resources/(.*)$",
      "target": "/test-resources/$1",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "destination": "ui5"
    },
    {
      "source": "^(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
    }
  ]
}
 
When I reset the destination to NoAuth + CAP service to mocked it does work perfectly (Except for the forbidden response from the cap action). Meaning, the get requests work.
 
Also what I find odd is that when I setup the destination and try to create a new SAPUI5 App from template and choose the destination even there it returns 500.
 
What am I missing?
 
Best regards,
Oliver

entry.title: How Joule Enhances Employee Experience in SAP SuccessFactors Enterprise Service Management
entry.content:
Employees today expect quick, intuitive, and personalized support—especially when navigating important life events like parental leave. SAP SuccessFactors Enterprise Service Management delivers on that expectation, with Joule, SAP’s AI copilot, at the heart of the experience.

AI-Powered Self-Sufficiency for Employees

Joule plays a critical role in making employees more self-sufficient by providing instant, conversational access to information and HR services. Whether they need to understand policies, complete tasks, or access resources, Joule guides them to the right answers and actions—without navigating complex portals or waiting on HR teams.

Key benefits for employees include:

  • Instant, personalized responses to HR questions
  • Guided access to relevant self-service actions, such as submitting requests or finding forms
  • A conversational, intuitive experience, available across devices

With Joule embedded in SAP SuccessFactors Enterprise Service Management, employees get the support they need, when they need it—within the flow of work.

Consider an employee, Alex, who is preparing for the arrival of a new baby and needs information about parental leave. Instead of searching through policies or submitting a ticket, Alex interacts with Joule.

Here’s how Joule enhances the experience:

Alex opens SAP SuccessFactors Work Zone and types:
“What do I need to do to apply for parental leave?”

Joule instantly responds:
“Congratulations! I can help you with that. Here's the parental leave policy and a step-by-step guide to apply. Would you like to start the process now?”

Alex selects 'Yes,' and Joule provides a link to the self-service form, pre-populated with relevant information.

If Alex has further questions—such as eligibility or pay details—Joule provides immediate answers or directs them to the appropriate resources.

Only if Alex faces a complex issue or needs additional support, Joule helps create a service request, capturing the conversation's context to streamline the process.

Minimizing Case Creation, Maximizing Experience

This example reflects the broader goal of modern HR service delivery: empowering employees to resolve everyday needs quickly while reducing unnecessary case creation.

Joule enables this by:

  • Deflecting cases through real-time answers and guided self-service
  • Providing easy access to policies, forms, and next steps
  • Only triggering case creation when personal assistance is truly needed

When a case is required, Joule captures the context and helps craft the request—saving time for both employees and HR teams.

A Smarter Way to Deliver HR Support

Joule is more than a chatbot—it’s an integral part of SAP’s vision for AI-driven HR service delivery. By combining intelligent self-service, conversational guidance, and smart case initiation, Joule enhances the overall employee experience while driving efficiency for HR teams.

In short: Joule makes it easier for employees to navigate important moments—like parental leave—quickly, confidently, and on their own terms.

Stay tuned for our next blog, where we will explore how generative AI within SAP SuccessFactors Enterprise Service Management is transforming the agent experience behind the scenes.

 For more solution info, please visit the SAP SuccessFactors Enterprise Service Management website.

entry.title: Re: GetDefaultsForItem issue
Best practice test cases for S/4 HANA processes in Cloud ALM
entry.content:
Prerequisites

We'll assume you have set up a Cloud ALM implementation project.
We will further assume you have already selected the process scope (chosen the S/4 standard processes you are looking to implement):


Cloud ALM End-to-End Implementation Process

With there prerequisites met,  we can already navigate to the processes and start downloading test cases.

 

Downloading a best practice test case

Open the Processes App in Cloud ALM and open a solution process.

With  tab "Solution Value flow" open on the left hand side, go to tab "Process Hierarchy Nodes" on the right hand side.
Scroll down to the "Accelerators" section and click the Link "Test script (SAP Cloud ALM)".
This will download an excel version of the best practice test case.

This Excel representation of the test case could be uploaded as a test case to cloud ALM right away, but the more likely scenario is that it will be adjusted first to make it fit your project / team / test data situation.
The best practice test cases are *very* detailed and cover a lot of additional information and preparational steps such as creating the necessary master data first. The "Accounting and Financial Close (J58)" case for example had 370 lines.

Note: Not all solution processes/country versions have a "Test script (SAP Cloud ALM)" available yet.
Some will just have a "Test script" (same content but in Word format rather than Excel).

 

Test case structure & editing in excel

The structure of a test case in Cloud ALM (and thus in the excel representation as well) is as follows:

  • Test Case
    • Activity 
      • Action
        • Action Title
        • Action Instructions
        • Action Expected Result 

The texts in the excel cells come HTML formatted. While not visible in Excel, the formating will be applied when the case is displayed in Cloud ALM.
Note: There are more columns in the excel, which have been hidden for this example to focus on what's relevant.

Once the test case has been adjusted in excel, save the excel and  upload the adjusted test case to Cloud ALM. 


Uploading the test case to Cloud ALM

Open Cloud ALM's  "Test preparation" app and click the "Upload test tase" button.
Chose the excel file, containing the previously adjusted test case, select a scope and start the upload. 

If everything works well, you will se the message "The item in your uploaded file will be created." and the new test case will appear in the "Test Peparation" app.

In case the upload of the test case fails, there will be (unless the structure is completely broken) a detailed error message, pointing you to the problem in the excel file:

In this example two Action Instructions were missing.

Once you click on the test case, you can make further adjustments in Cloud ALM.
You will recognize the already familiar structure:

The hierarchical numbering (i.e. "6.1") is automatically added by Cloud ALM.

 

Next Steps 

What happens next?
Typically the test case is (once reviewed/signed off) switched to status "Prepared", which makes it available for test execution.
The test case can now be added to a test plan ("Test Plans" app), where a tester can be assigned  and then test execution/documentation can begin with the "Test execution" app.

 

Summary / closing thoughts

Best practice test cases now being readily available in CLoud ALM uploadable excel format is a major convenience gain.
More Cloud ALM features/improvements are being rolled out on a bi-weekly schedule. You can stay up-to-date with the links below:
Which Cloud ALM features have been added recently? LINK
Which Cloud ALM features are in the pipeline? LINK
Want to try Cloud ALM for yourself? Try the Public Demo System.

entry.title: Re: SAP Public cloud Sourcing and Procurement- Monitor Pu...
entry.content:
Hi Rush

Thanks for confirming all your settings and sharing the screenshots. This helps pinpoint the issue precisely.

You mentioned you created this PO via SAP GUI, not through the Fiori app, which leads to the core issue. Please note that GUI-created POs are not supported for visibility in Fiori down payment monitoring. The Monitor Purchase Order Down Payments app only recognizes down payments created via the Fiori process, using: “Create Purchase Order Advanced” then followed by “Manage Supplier Down Payment Requests”.

Note that POs created manually via SAP GUI are not captured by the Monitor app and therefore never appear in F2877. 

Even though you've verified that the PO is approved and the down payment is defined at item level, the Monitor Purchase Order Down Payments (F2877) app intentionally does not support POs created using SAP GUI. It only tracks POs built via the Fiori "Create Purchase Order Advanced" app followed by the standard down payment request flow. To resolve this, I recommend the following:

  • Recreate your PO via the Fiori app instead of SAP GUI.
  • Assign the Mandatory Down Payment at the item level.
  • Go through Monitor Purchase Order Down Payments, then “Create Down Payment Request” and finally “Manage Supplier Down Payment Requests”.

Once the PO is built in the Fiori flow, it will show up for monitoring. This is fully documented and the only SAP‑supported way in Public Cloud.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Sales Document Approval – Standard Workflow : Re-Approval
entry.content:
We have had standard sales workflow active for a number of years.
Any change to an already approved sales document requires re-approval, this includes delivery dates, ATP, Customer reference - non critical in our business.

We wish to implement functionality on change of document to only require re-approval on certain key field change (eg prices, qty etc).

How can we achieve this? The BADI for setting the Approval Reason is accessible and we can apply logic here. However it will only either set (or not set the approval reason) - it resets the Approval Status requiring re-approval. We wish to maintain the existing Approval Status.

Thanks for any advice.

Dan

entry.title: Re: New SAP Hybris Cloud for Customer consultant - Need t...
entry.content: Thank you!
